questions.question_text: A customer is migrating their existing Splunk Indexer from an old set of hardware to a new set of indexers. What is the earliest method to migrate the system?

discussion.content:
A is correct
There is no need to configure a new site

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

choices.B: 1. Add new indexers to the cluster as peers, to a new site. 2. Ensure new indexers receive common configuration from the CM. 3. Decommission old indexers (one at a time) to allow time for CM to fix/migrate buckets to new hardware. 4. Remove all the old indexers from the CM's list.
choices.A: 1. Add new indexers to the cluster as peers, in the same site (if needed). 2. Ensure new indexers receive common configuration. 3. Decommission old indexers (one at a time) to allow time for CM to fix/migrate buckets to new hardware. 4. Remove all the old indexers from the CM's list.
choices.C: 1. Add new indexers to the cluster as peers, in the same site. 2. Update the replication factor by +1 to Instruct the cluster to start replicating to new peers. 3. Allow time for CM to fix/migrate buckets to new hardware. 4. Remove all the old indexers from the CM's list.
choices.D: 1. Add new indexers to the cluster as new site. 2. Update cluster master (CM) server.conf to include the new available site. 3. Allow time for CM to fix/migrate buckets to new hardware. 4. Remove the old indexers from the CM's list.

choices.C: Convert the cluster to multi-site and modify the server.conf to be site_replication_factor=2, site_search_factor=2.
choices.A: Enable maintenance mode on the CM to prevent excessive fix-up and bring the failed indexer back online.
choices.B: Leave replication_factor=2, increase search_factor=2 and enable summary_replication.
choices.D: Increase replication_factor=3, search_factor=2 to protect the data, and allow there to always be a searchable copy.

questions.question_text:
The customer has an indexer cluster supporting a wide variety of search needs, including scheduled search, data model acceleration, and summary indexing.
Here is an excerpt from the cluster mater's server.conf:
//IMG//

Which strategy represents the minimum and least disruptive change necessary to protect the searchability of the indexer cluster in case of indexer failure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - this is the only answer that increases redundancy (replication_factor) which is the main point of the question

Selected Answer: B
I would also say that B is the correct one.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct
Answer is "B" as is "...minimum and least disruptive change"

comments.content: "...minimum and least disruptive change"...migrating to multisite, is not that.

discussion.content:
Splunk reference is for rep factor of 3 in order to tolerate a failure of 2 nodes; which assumes that the cluster is made of of the min of 3 nodes. 
B would assume that the cluster is 2 nodes and the nodes would have a search each

questions.question_text: When using SAML, where does user authentication occur?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Identity provider (IDP) maintains the user credentials and handles authentication.
Ref: CI Notes p.101

Selected Answer: C
With SAML, an Identity Provider is what handles authentication.

choices.C: The Identity Provider (IDP) decodes the SAML request and authenticates the user.
choices.B: The Service Provider (SP) decodes the SAML request and authenticates the user.
choices.D: The Service Provider (SP) generates a SAML assertion that authenticates the user.
choices.A: Splunk generates a SAML assertion that authenticates the user.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following server roles should be configured for a host which indexes its internal logs locally?
The Splunk Validated Architectures (SVAs) document provides a series of approved Splunk topologies. Which statement accurately describes how it should be used by a customer?

choices.C: Using the guided requirements gathering in the SVAs document, choose a topology that suits requirements, and be sure not to deviate from the specified design.
choices.A: Customer should look at the category tables, pick the highest number that their budget permits, then select this design topology as the chosen design.
choices.D: Choose an SVA topology code that includes Search Head and Indexer Clustering because it offers the highest level of resilience.
choices.B: Customers should identify their requirements, provisionally choose an approved design that meets them, then consider design principles and best practices to come to an informed design decision.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
